statement:
Lagrange’s four-square theorem states that every non-negative integer
may be expressed as the sum of at most four squares. By the Euler
four-square identity, it is enough to show that every prime is
expressible by at most four squares. It was later proved that only the
numbers of the form $4^n(8m + 7)$ require four squares.
